div.div: For traffic between host and its owning DPU, we will always use the hardcoded reserved VNI (VM Tunnel VNI) to encap the traffic.

switch.text: For traffic between host and its owning DPU,...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 286px; height: 1px; padding-top: 765px; margin-left: 57px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 15px; font-family: Consolas, Monaco; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: For traffic coming from SmartSwitch-enabled VNET, NPU uses protocol DST IP + inner source MAC to lookup the nexthop (DPU).

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 286px; height: 1px; padding-top: 920px; margin-left: 57px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 15px; font-family: Consolas, Monaco; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
For local DPU, NPU moves the port directly to the DPU port and send it out without encap.
NPU tunnel is used only when talking to remote DPUs.

switch.text: For local DPU, NPU moves the port dire...

div.div:
SRC=<VM1 PA>, DST=<DPU1 VIP>,
VNI=<VM Tunnel VNI>

div.div: NPU uses BGP to advertise the DP VIPs to receive traffic, instead of DPU.

switch.text: NPU uses BGP to advertise the DP VIPs...

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
